section.title: Begin Finite Burn
section.para: This was created using the June 18, 2008 build of GMAT.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The Begin Finite Burn and End Finite Burn commands are very simple. When the Begin Finite Burn command is entered into the mission sequence it will initiate the thrusters of the spacecraft until the End Finite Burn command is reached. After the finite burn is turned off, the spacecraft's thrusters will shut down.

section.title: Listing of Objects and Commands that interact

listitem.para: A spacecraft must exist so the finite burn has an object to apply itself to, and a Begin Finite Burn command is how to do just that.
To apply a Begin Finite Burn command, a Finite Burn must exist in the resource tree under the Burns folder.

section.title: Using the GUI
section.para: In the dialog boxes of both the Begin and End commands there are two fields that incorporate a finite burn from the resource tree and any spacecraft created for the mission. All of the spacecraft are in a list alongside radio buttons and are checked or unchecked, depending on whether or not the burn should be applies to them.

listitem.para: This menu lists all of the finite burns created, and from this, one burn can be selected to be used on the spacecraft checked in the adjacent menu.

Here all of the spacecraft are listed and are accompanied by a radio button. If the box is checked, that spacecraft will experience the finite burn wherever it is set to occur in the mission sequence.

entry.para: The ManeuverName option allows the user to choose between any previously created finite burn. As an example, to maneuver DefaultSC using DefaultFB, the script linewould appear as Manevuer DefaultFB(DefaultSC).
The SpacecraftName option allows the user to select which spacecraft to maneuver using the maneuver selected in the ManeuverName option.
